meanings.definition: A unit of weight equal to 1/16 of a pound or 28.35 grams.
meanings.sent1: She measured the flour in ounces for the recipe.
meanings.sent2: He only needed a few ounces of milk for his cereal.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to catch the elusive mouse that weighed only a few ounces.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him weighed more than a thousand ounces of gold.
meanings.sent5: The baby's laughter was as light as a feather, but it carried more joy than a thousand ounces.

meanings.sent1: He added a few more ounces of sugar to sweeten the tea.
meanings.sent2: There were only a couple of ounces of water left in the bottle.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel gathered ounces of nuts for the winter, but forgot where it hid them.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was worth more than all the ounces of wealth in the world.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brushstrokes added just the right ounces of color to bring the painting to life.
